name: paper-item
description: Material Design: Menus `paper-item` is a simple item object for use in menus. When the user touches the item, a ripple effect emanates from the point of contact. If used in a `core-selector`, the selected item will be highlighted. Example: Cut Copy Paste Links ----- To use as a link, put an `` element in the item. You may also use the `noink` attribute to prevent the ripple from "freezing" during a page navigation. Example: Polymer

attributes.name: raised
attributes.description: If true, the button will be styled with a shadow.

attributes.name: recenteringTouch
attributes.description:
By default the ripple emanates from where the user touched the button.
Set this to true to always center the ripple.

attributes.name: fill
attributes.description:
By default the ripple expands to fill the button. Set this to false to
constrain the ripple to a circle within the button.
